page.title: 03Kington :Tourist attractions
page.content: There are many tourist attractions in Kington. Among them are Hergest Croft Gardens and Park Wood. They bring many visitors during spring and summer especially in May and June when the rhododendroms and azaleas are in bloom. Bradnor Hill and Hergest Ridge provide 1500 acres of open hill walking for the energetic walker. In the town there are many historic sites including the 17th century grammer school, castle mound and early 19th century hosre drawn railway. The Kington Festival takes place in the middle of June.{Facilities.}There is a camp site which has recently been opened, situated near the recreation ground. There are a few hotels and a lot of cottages. Country pubs offer bed and breakfast accommodation. Some of the pubs also serve lunch for the passing tourist.
